intro: Leiothrix hirsuta var. magalhaesii, commonly known as the hairy leiothrix, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. The leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a rough, textured surface. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and modest floral display.
